The coefficient of kinetic friction between the block and the plank is μ = 0.20, and the maximum static friction between the block and the plank is equal to the kinetic friction. Take g = 10 m/s². One person applies a horizontal constant force F₁ to the left on the block, while another person applies a vertical constant force F₂ upward to pull the block, causing the block to start moving upward from rest. To make the wooden board move upward, what condition must F₁ satisfy?
